name: Le Meridien Phuket Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon in September 2007. The resort is gorgeous, and my husband loved it and would stay again. I, however, would have to rethink another stay.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, but SO buggy

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Brilliant from start to finsh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --Amazing resort and grounds
reviews.title: great hotel but not well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --Gorgeous pool
reviews.title: Good resort

likes.disliked: — Lack of free shuttle service to Patong or Karon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --Amazing white sand private beach - in all my research I decided this was the best beach, and I think I was right. Ample beach chairs and towels available.
reviews.title: Great beach

reviews.text: If you don't want to stay in the cesspool known as Patong Beach then the Le Meridien at Karong Beach is perfect. It is a 5 min cab ride away from Patong beach.
reviews.title: Great quiet hotel

likes.liked: — secluded beach and so many activities

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights including Chinese New year where they had a fireworks display. The hotel was booked out so we couldn't upgrade to a bigger room.
reviews.title: very tired resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The private beach is excellent and the pool is close to one of the best I have seen.
reviews.title: Beautiful private beach

likes.disliked: — service was slow at times during lunchtime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are activities galore and if you have kids you will be able to keep them happy. From Pool aerobics, pool basketball to the intro scuba dive for kids. The hotel has it all and then some.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Great Hotel and Location
reviews.text: We also were able to fit in a game of mini golf, but missed the rock climbing, table tennis and giant chess set.

I know the evaluation of each hotel depends of the expectations of the guests. In my case, I red the reviews about Le Meridien with good and bad opinions, but I decided to go there because it was a Le Meridien and it was close to Patong Beach.
reviews.title: Take care!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: First of all the hotel is not an exclusive 5 stars hotel. It is an old 5 stars now offering packages for a massive tourist mainly for east Europe and Russia.
reviews.title: Tired hotel, over priced and over rated

reviews.text: However the worst thing we experience was a terrible problem with the tuk-tuk mafia and the security staff of the hotel. In fact, we take a tuk tuk at the hotel for going to Patong. Just crossing the security point of the hotel, 2 guys stopped the tuk tuk, talked with the driver and shouting us asked us to go out because the tuk tuk could not go to Patong.
reviews.title: Best family holiday we've ever had!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked the security staff and they didn´t do anything, even the man charged of them. After we complain at the hotel and we only receive, the next day when we decide to leave the Hotel and move to another one, an rediculous explanation from the room manager.
reviews.title: Special holiday

reviews.text: What happened is that there are a tuk tuk mafia in Phuket and there are people from outside the hotel who allow or not some tuk tuk to take passanger at the hotel, and all of these with the deal of the security staff of the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect quiet family break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Le Meridien is located remotely away from the busy crowds of Patong beach. The resort offers everything from shopping, various dinning restaurants, spa, resident elephant, and all sorts of activities that you can baiscally stay at the resort and never leave. The hotel has one of the best private beachs in my opinion, the sand was so fine, it felt like we were stepping on mud. However, the cost of food in the hotel is expensive compare to what you can get in Patong. This place is great place for families. However, I highly recommend everyone venture out to Patong for food, you can get a much better deal for your money.
reviews.title: Love the Le Meridien

likes.liked: — The resort is stunning in architecture and what it can offer
likes.disliked: — The cost of food in the resort

reviews.text: This is a beautiful resort with all the activities and amendities anyone would need to have a wonderful vacation. The best part is the private beach which allows you to relax away from the noisy crowds and busy traffic in Patong Beach. Their private beach is also one of the best beaches in Phuket. Free activities include a climbing wall, archery, golf driving range, tennis courts, etc. A true resort in all sense of the word. All this is topped of by a resident baby elephant that comes out a couple of times a day with which guests can take pictures.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

likes.liked: — Private beach and free resort activities
likes.disliked: — 5 to 10 minute ride to Patong Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only small drawback of the hotel is the distance from main town of Patong Beach. The 5 to 10 minute taxi / tuk tuk ride to and from the hotel will cost you 200 bahts each way, which isn't too bad. And like all hotels, their restaurants are nice but overpriced. I would recommend dining in Patong instead and eat as the locals do. One thing that is a very good deal at the hotel is the huge mixed fruit plate on the beach fruit/snack shack for 150 baht.
reviews.title: good hotel

likes.liked: — sitting on balcony listening to the waves

reviews.text: Firstly apologies for such a late review. We arrived at the Le meridien after a four night stay at the Shangri La hotel in Bangkok (see review). On arrival our room was not quite ready and we waited approx one hour this was by no means a problem as we just went for a drink. The first room we were given was a garden superior room which I did not like, The room itself smelt really musty (yes I know I am in a tropical country ) but this was very strong as though the room had not been used for some time. I contacted reception and they offered me an ocean deluxe at a reasonable rate, absolute bliss sitting on the balcony drinking wine and listening to the sound of the sea you can't beat it.
reviews.title: Loved it ... will go again!

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly especially reception always remembered our name, the restaurants are good, of course they are going to be more expensive than outside the hotel but I didn't find them ridiculously expensive. My only gripe with the facilities is I think the hotel may benefit from a lobby bar somewhere to go of a night instead of the club especially in low season when it is often raining of a night and you don't want to go to the pool bar (open sides). Apart from that this hotel is an excellent base near enough to patong but far enough away from the maddening crowd and its big plus own beach which is fabulous. All in all I would certainly go back to this hotel just for the peace and quiet after a night in patong.
reviews.title: the best beach

aka: Le Meridien Phuket Beach Hotel Karon
description: Le Meridien Phuket Beach Resort is located on a lush cove on Phuket’s southwestern coast with a secluded 500-metre pristine white-sand beach. One of very few hotels on Phuket where guests can enjoy a tranquil secluded beach right next to the hotel without the need to cross a street or walk some distance. Le Meridien Phuket Beach offers 470 renovated rooms and suites including Deluxe Ocean View Rooms, Deluxe Terrace Rooms, and Ocean View Junior Suites fully renovated in October 2013. Enjoy a complete range of sports and recreational facilities with two oversized tropical swimming pools, shaded kids pool, lap pool, 6 tennis courts, 2 air-conditioned squash courts, 9-hole mini-golf, rock-climbing wall, basketball court, and a dedicated on-site Penguin Club for kids (04-12 yrs) offering fun, creative, and educational programmes. Use of the Penguin Club's facilities and all non-motorised watersports at the Resort are free.Le Spa, awarded 'Amazing Resort Spa' at the 2013 Thailand Spa and Well-Being Awards, offers pampering treatments and luxurious programmes designed to rejuvinate and refresh the senses.There are 10 restaurants and bars offering the world's more popular cuisines including a refurbished Pakarang Restaurant and a new Le Meridien-branded 'Latest Recipe' Restaurant opened in October 2013.Le Meridien Phuket Beach Resort is only 5kms away from Patong and Karon, Phuket's main entertainment and shopping districts and is a 45-minute drive from Phuket International Airport and 5 kms from the shopping and entertainment district of Patong.
